name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Today‚Äôs announcement will reunite thousands of families and communities. We need to deschedule marijuana, legalize it in every state and pardon all who have been convicted of marijuana possession - now!

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: In states where it is legalized, I also urge lawmakers and business leaders to make the marijuana industry more accessible - especially for those who have been historically harmed by predatory marijuana laws and restrictions.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: I hope that more states follow President Biden‚Äôs lead today and that of states where marijuana is now legalized.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Many states, including New York, have legalized marijuana for recreational use and studies show a significant majority of Americans support legalization for medical and recreational use in every state.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text:
In communities of color and underserved communities, having a conviction for marijuana possession changes the trajectory of one‚Äôs life and has a lasting impact for those attempting to find work, housing or even get an education. 

That is unacceptable.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: This comes after I wrote a letter to President Biden last year, alongside our Congressional Cannabis Caucus co-chairs @repblumenauer and @RepBarbaraLee, calling for the federal pardon of all non-violent cannabis convictions.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: President Biden‚Äôs decision to pardon all federal offenses of simple marijuana possession brings us that much closer to restoring justice in our communities that have been targeted for decades.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Finally, our federal system is recognizing the harm marijuana convictions have had on people and communities for generations, and is attempting to rectify that harm.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: We can and we must revolutize our public schools to be child-centered in meaningful ways - from smaller class sizes to leading the way on energy efficient public spaces in the face of the climate crisis.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Thanks to the collective power of those closest to the classroom, all New Yorkers will benefit from smaller classroom sizes. I‚Äôm committed to being a partner in this work and will continue to fight for the Green New Deal for Public Schools in Congress.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: This progress would not have happened without the long term organizing led by public education activists, such as @ClassSizeMatter and @leoniehaimson. They refused a corporate model of education that prioritizes saving money over educating children.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: When it comes to our budgetary priorities, we need to absolutely increase funding for public education, and we also need to ensure that that funding prioritizes students‚Äô needs.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Smaller class sizes lead to increased possibilities for kids, which is what every family wants and deserves for their children.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Research shows that students in smaller classes do better in school, are more likely to graduate high school, and pursue higher education.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Decreasing classroom sizes to 20-25 students is a long overdue, evidenced-based investment that students, teachers, and families have been calling for for years.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Overcrowded classrooms are often cited as one of the reasons why more and more teachers are leaving the classroom. By contrast, wealthy school districts more often have the resources and staffing capacity to offer smaller class sizes.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: In New York, teachers can be expected to serve a classroom with as many as 34 children, which doesn‚Äôt realistically allow for children to meaningfully grow in a supportive, enriching learning environment.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Our least resourced public schools serving predominantly Black and Brown children are the ones most often forced to increase class sizes due to a lack of funding and teachers.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: These are the kinds of investments in public schools that lead to improved learning and teaching conditions.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Our students and teachers deserve to thrive, and smaller classroom sizes in New York City is a fundamental step in the right direction to promote positive growth and development for our kids.

tweet_text:

This is for street, bicycle, and pedestrian improvements to connect the Lincoln Ave neighborhood to downtown reducing safety and connectivity issues while boosting economic growth.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text:

This path would give low-income residents access to green space fostering social equity.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text: Reparations could take many forms ‚Äî direct payments, targeted investment, expanded public services, or otherwise ‚Äî but given that the Republicans oppose our government assisting those in need, they‚Äôre likely to deem any and all of these solutions unworkable.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text:
Our Republican colleagues argued that reparations would be divisive, ineffective, and difficult to adjudicate.

Here is the truth:

HR 40 is absolutely necessary to help us understand how the government can pursue restorative justice for communities impacted by American racism.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweet_text:
